author: eosfor
body:
Hello, colleagues, I've put all my "troubleshooting" steps into the bigger article, [here](https://eosfor.github.io/2018/Episode1-Issues-with-Argument-Completers/). In short what I've found is that when scriptblock is passed to  ```[ArgumentCompleter()]``` as a parameter, does not see functions local to a module.

Or, maybe i do something wrong?


Expected behavior
-----------------
When ```[ArgumentCompleter()]``` "runs" a script block, it should attach it to a module "local scope".  I mean that it should see functions local to the module/script, because commonly I don't want to export "completers" out of a module

Actual behavior
---------------
When ```[ArgumentCompleter()]``` "calls" a script block passed to it, scriptblock, looks like does not see internal functions of a module, but it seems to be able to see them if they are exported to a global scope.
